This game was originally F2P, but in 2022 the devs decided to charge 20$ for it. My issue isnt the price itself, but the reason behind it. Instead of implementing proper anti-cheat measures, the devs chose to fight cheaters by putting the game behind a paywall. Honestly, a genius move. The game was (and probably still is) in a rough state, so why fix anything when you can simply put a price tag on it? Literally free money. 

To be fair, old players could still play game for free, which i appreciate. And here is a tip: if you have Meta Quest set, the game is F2P in Meta services(the only reason I refunded the game), so you know what to do.

Gorilla Tag is like nothing else I’ve ever played. The movement system is wild—forget buttons, you’re literally swinging, climbing, and leaping with your virtual hands. It feels chaotic at first, but once you get the hang of it, it’s incredibly rewarding.
The game thrives on its simplicity, yet the community adds layers of excitement (and sometimes, frustration). If you’re in for laughs and adrenaline-filled chases, this is your game. Just remember, it's as much about dodging toxic lobbies as it is about dodging gorillas. Still, the raw fun makes it worth the adventure!
10/10 for pure monkey madness! 🐒
